fields.summary: Wireframe Metrics landing page tile view

issuetype.description: A user story. Created by JIRA Software - do not edit or delete.
issuetype.name: Story

status.description: A resolution has been taken, and it is awaiting verification by reporter. From here issues are either reopened, or are closed.
status.name: Resolved

comments.body: a simple version would be single-selection in tile view and show the graph right away.

[~jloza], in implementing this, I got the grid looking pretty good w/ section headings like the wireframe. I'm struggling a little with how the graphs should work. Initially, I thought "click a tile and pop up the graph for that metric". The hitch there is that modals slide down from the top and if the user's slide a little down the list of metrics (or a lot), the graph will show off-screen.
If I were to scroll the view up to the graph modal at the top of the page, if the user dismisses the modal, would we attempt to return them to the position they were in the page of tiles?

An alternative is showing a graph-only page. This may be fine for mobile.
yeah, I think the graph-only page would be OK here. We can play with this and see what works best.
[~jloza], it's mostly done. I imagine you'd want some minor tweaks, so lets look at this. I'll put something on your calendar.

possible todo list:
 - tile title should be resource name(id) [done]
 - Add menu option to view graph, in place of tile clicking [done]
 - tile title should be clickable (hover green, hand cursor) and take you to graph page [done]
 - click outside tile action menu fails to close menu [done]
 - breadcrumbs should show metric and dimensions (metric name - [resource name/id]) Graph (no slash before graph) [done]
 - locate refresh button next to action menu, like on large-chart dialog? (left as-is because other large charts have refresh button in the same location)
 - in small-screen, controls should stack (true for all large chart screens?)

Small correction to to-do list: Tile title should be resource name OR ID...we shouldn't put the name (ID) there as it won't fit. ID goes in the tile content itself if name is present. This is the design on all landing page tiles (implementation is buggy if that's not how it's implemented)

The rule put in to prevent that odd layout issue w/ absolute time prevents the proper stacking at smaller screen sizes. Not sure the right fix yet.
May just open a separate ticket for that since small view isn't high priority. (GUI-2534)


https://github.com/eucalyptus/eucaconsole/pull/1896

Awesome, [~dkavanagh]! 

Some nits:
* Tile titles look great (show names when available, show IDs when not), but the ID field in the tile content area should **only** show the ID, not the name also. Screenshot attached. [done]
* Should hide "<x>" selected at top since this page is single select [done]
* There seems to be a tile above the group headers. I am logged into UI test acct 00. See attached screenshot, I don't know what group this belongs to, but each tile shoudl be below a section header. I think it should be in EC2 - per instance. It's rogue!
* Sections should be in same order as they are in table view, please. [they are]
* EC2 - across all instances should not have ID field in content area, and is missing title (see wireframe) [done]
* EC2 - instances by scaling group shouldn't have ID in content area [done]
* same with  ec2 - per instance type [done]
* EC2 - per image, ID in content area is not showing the actual ID I don;t think? Is it? [yes, click on ID and see that name matches]
* all ELB metrics shouldn't have ID in content area [done]
* can't see custom metrics but be sure those don't show ID either, I don't think they have one? [done]
* "graph" in breadcrumb should be lowercase [done]

wrote bug GUI-2535 to implement sorting.

I included all elb metric categories to not display ID.
The problem w/ not displaying ID field on some tiles is that we no longer link to the resource directly. Remember, you had me link the tile title to the graph screen (as well as have a menu item to view the graph).
I also don't see the rogue tile like you pictured. We may need to screen-share.

Original comment mentioned **all** elb tiles. :)

If we need to change the link destination for the title a tag later we can if users complain, but we shouidn't show ID fields for things that don't have IDs...

* EC2 across all instances tiles still missing title. 
* rogue tile and ebs section out of place on chrome

other issues fixed, thanks!
OK, got that sorted out.

A couple of small things still:

* EC2: across all instances are above the section header, screenshot attached
* ELB: missing across all load balancers, and also section headers are abbreviated instead of having words spelled out. Please check wireframe and match that

Thanks!

Oh, that "all instances" header is odd. I'll look into that. 
About "all elbs", we never had that. See the categories defined here:
https://github.com/eucalyptus/eucaconsole/blob/master/eucaconsole/views/metrics.py#L57-L124
I do see that in the wireframe now. I can add that.
Thanks!
Oh, joy. After adding all elbs, that shows properly on ff and chrome. But, the all instances is wrong on chrome, but not FF.
Perhaps [~ethomas] or [~sjones] could clarify but, unlike an "All instances" dimension for EC2 metrics, CloudWatch doesn't seem to offer an "All ELBs" dimension for ELB metrics.
Ah, the AWS console allows creation of an alarm  "Across all ELBs", so at least AWS seems to support that. [~ethomas]: Does Eucalyptus support the "All ELBs" dimension for alarms with ELB metrics?

[~kgill] I think [~spark] is the authority on ELB dimensions, but as I recall all ELB metrics contain Availability Zone and Load Balancer name.  I think it aggregates by 'all' by leaving out one or both of the dimensions.  So if you have no AZ, it will total all load balancers with the given name, and if you have no LoadBalancerName, it will total all load balancers in the AZ.  If you have no dimensions at all it will total everything.  This is from memory, however.
[~dkavanagh], Is this ticket ready for me to review or is there additional work needed?
I thought you were waiting for that GUI-2538 ticket to be complete, or that's what you said on that ticket.
Yeah, but with all the commenting about the All ELBs thing just wondering if that is included and this is ready for me or not?

[~dkavanagh], still seeing rogue tile and missing default sort on Chrome. Clearing cache and local storage did not help. Things seem fine on FF. Tracking that in GUI-2535, moved that to top of swimlane so it's the next thing for you to fix please. I can't approve this ticket until that works. Thanks!

yay, almost there! 

All ELBs tiles: titles say All instances instead of what's shown in wireframe

Yay! latest push fixed that last issue, thanks [~dkavanagh].

UX review passed, ready for code review.

Verified metrics grid view looks good.  Also verified sorting works and item-level actions (show graph, create alarm, copy graph URL) all work as expected.

Verified on: shared setup (region-two) - https://g-05-03.qa1.eucalyptus-systems.com
Account: kamalgill/admin
Tested on: Chrome (incognito mode) Version 51.0.2704.84 (64-bit)
Tested on: IE 11 on Windows 8.1 (Version 11.0.9600.18350)
Release: 0.9502.209.gitb005964.el7
